meanings.definition: An innate, typically fixed pattern of behavior in animals in response to certain stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The bird's instinct led it to build a nest without any prior learning.
meanings.sent2: Her instinct told her to run when she heard a loud noise behind her.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the squirrel's instinct to hide nuts in random places.
meanings.sent4: His instinct for survival kicked in when he found himself in a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent5: The mother's instinct to protect her young was incredibly strong.

meanings.definition: A natural or intuitive way of acting or thinking.
meanings.sent1: She followed her instinct and chose the right path without overthinking.
meanings.sent2: His instinct for fairness made him stand up for his friend in need.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch his instinct to always check his pockets before leaving.
meanings.sent4: Her instinct for creativity led her to paint the most beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The detective's instinct for solving mysteries never failed him.
